title: Liverpool to trigger Spanish striker's €50million buy-out clause? Saturday's transfer gossip round-up
text:
Liverpool are said to be leading the race to sign Inaki Williams (Photo: David Ramos) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool are reportedly prepared to trigger Inaki Williams' buy-out clause at Athletic Bilbao. 
Italian outlet Calcio Mercato say the Reds are leading the race to sign the highly-rated 22-year-old forward, who recently hinted he would be willing to leave Bilbao if a bigger club comes in for him. 
"I’m happy in Bilbao but if a concrete offer comes in from elsewhere then I’m happy to sit round the table and discuss my options with my agent and the club," the Spaniard said. 
Williams is contracted to the Basque club until 2021 but his deal contains a €50million buy-out clause which Liverpool are considering activating. 
Here is the latest news and gossip from Saturday's papers: Saturday's transfer stories from the Mirror 
West Ham have lined up a shock move for Bacary Sagna. The France international right-back, who turns 34 next week, is out of contract at Manchester City this summer. Bacary Sagna is on West Ham's radar (Photo: Getty) 
Antonio Conte has played down speculation linking Manchester United with a summer swoop for Willian. The Chelsea star worked with Jose Mourinho at Stamford Bridge and the Special One is reportedly keen on a reunion with the Brazilian. 
Jose Mourinho is confident Real Madrid will not embark on another 'dirty tricks' campaign to sign David De Gea. Bernabeu president Florentino Perez claimed someone at Manchester United is “messing around” with keeper De Gea, with his European champions poised to make a fresh move after failing to land the player 18 months ago. Other news stories from Saturday's Mirror 
Angry Mark Hughes has accused Tony Pulis of branding Stoke captain Ryan Shawcross a “loser” as he stoked their row with West Brom over Saido Berahino. Potters manager Hughes claims Baggies counterpart Pulis left a voicemail for Shawcross hitting back at the defender’s accusation that Albion had leaked news of their ex-striker Berahino’s drug ban following his January move to Stoke. The warring Welshmen are refusing to let the dispute die after failing to shake hands before or after the game between their teams at The Hawthorns last week, which West Brom won 1-0. Mark Hughes, left, and Tony Pulis, right, are at loggerheads (Photo: Getty Images / Reuters) 
Sam Allardyce has turned to a shrink to help halt second-bottom Crystal Palace's slide. Boss Allardyce has brought in Lee Richardson, a former player, coach and Chesterfield manager who he worked with previously at West Ham. Big Sam is a big believer in sports psychologists, and reckons Richardson can help rid his players of the "fear" that grips them when they play at their Selhurst Park home. 
Crystal Palace's lucky eagle mascot has been absent from recent home matches due to bird flu fears. Palace's form has plummeted since American bald eagle Kayla stopped showing up at games, with the Selhurst Park club languishing in 19th position in the Premier League. Fans have been wondering about Kayla's whereabouts but it has now been revealed that her absence is related to avian flu. Gossip from other newspapers and websites 
Antoine Griezmann will outright reject a summer move to Manchester United if they fail to qualify for next season's Champions League. (Sun) Antoine Griezmann will reportedly reject a move to United if Champions League football isn't on offer (Photo: Getty) 
United have joined Barcelona in the pursuit of Monaco's Bernardo Silva, 22, but he could cost as much as €70million. (Le10Sport) Tottenham are interested in signing Demarai Gray from Leicester City. (London Evening Standard) Like us on Facebook
